result.execSummary:
The defendant Errin D Durham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS. Balance to be paid within 90 days; alternate 1 day jaill

Defendant Errin D Durham in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. Michael D. made statements. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 60 days jail with huber commencing 09/08/2014 by 7:00 p.m..  Huber with standard release conditions.
- Court costs of $268.00 - apply bail
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - apply bail, balance to be paid in 90 days; alternate 1 day jail consecutive
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
